item.title: Acquired: Forge3 Joins Agency Revolution
item.dc:creator: Forge3 Team
item.description:
I’m an insurance guy. My dad worked at Chubb his entire career. He started as an underwriter out of the...

The post Acquired: Forge3 Joins Agency Revolution appeared first on Forge3.
item.content:encoded:
I’m an insurance guy.

My dad worked at Chubb his entire career. He started as an underwriter out of the Pittsburgh office, moved his way up, and retired as President and CEO of PLI Brokerage. It was a large, independent insurance agency owned by Chubb and later sold to HUB International.

Following in Dad’s footsteps, I began my career at Chubb in the late 90s, initially working part-time while going to college and eventually joining full-time as Webmaster after I graduated. Insurance runs deep in the Teschke family.

I’ve always been a huge fan of the independent insurance model. I see the tremendous value carriers and agents bring to families and businesses everyday and wanted to do more to help the industry, especially as technology began to play a bigger role.

And that’s why I created Forge3.

The early years were far from glamorous, but when we launched our ActiveAgency website platform in 2016, things really took off.

The concept was simple. We wanted to build a cost-effective website solution for insurance agencies that helped them look amazing, get found, sell more, and service better. We added the industry’s most innovative sales tools and features like Clickable Coverage, Hello Producer, Power Panels, Video Proposals, and more, all wrapped in a highly customized design unique to each agency.

We’ve grown every month since launching ActiveAgency and now have well over 1,200 agencies using ActiveAgency across the country and around the world. On average, an agency signs up every day.

Agency Revolution, an FMG Suite Company, Acquires Forge3

ActiveAgency has quickly become the industry’s highest-rated, fastest-growing website platform. We’re committed to continue pushing the platform forward and have some very cool things in the works. More to come on that later.

However, there’s more to today’s marketing than merely having a website. And that’s where Agency Revolution comes in. They have a powerful marketing automation and communications platform called Fuse. It enables insurance agencies to stay in touch with prospects, clients, and other contacts with an automated, done-for-you solution using emails, text messages, and more.

For example, Fuse can send an automated email to clients that have a policy renewal coming up. That email will appear to come “from” you and your agency and could have a link to the Policy Review Form on your ActiveAgency website. Once there, your client completes the form by answering targeted questions that you can then use to identify coverage gaps and cross-sell opportunities. And it’s all automated. But that’s just one simple example. There’s so much more that’s possible.

Ultimately, our goal has always been to empower the independent insurance market with innovative, best-in-class technology backed by friendly, human-powered service and support. There are some exciting possibilities with integrating our website platform with Fuse in the months and years ahead.

Our Reputation and Team

More than anything else, I’m most proud of our reputation within the industry (see the raw, unedited feedback). This doesn’t happen by accident. We have an incredible team dedicated to wowing people daily. I will forever be amazed and thankful to be part of the journey with them. It’s really incredible to see.

Our entire team is remaining in place. In fact, we just added three more folks last month. So, all of the people you know and love will continue to provide outstanding service, helpfulness, and smiles, just as they always have.

My role will be a bit different going forward. I’ll continue to facilitate the transition as an advisor to the combined companies and will always be a champion and advocate for the industry in general. But, after 6,646 days (that’s 18+ years!) with Forge3, I’m also looking forward to stepping back slightly to spend some quality time with family, friends, and the things that matter most in life.

Questions and What’s Next

As with any announcement like this, there will likely be excitement mixed with plenty of questions and concerns. To start, read the announcement and check out the FAQs.

Thank you for being part of our success story. It means more than you realize.

Forever forge ahead!

The post Acquired: Forge3 Joins Agency Revolution appeared first on Forge3.

item.title: Inside Forge3: Quarterly Meeting and Top Golf!
item.dc:creator: Monika Baraket
item.description:
A look into our May Quarterly Meeting and Top Golf! The whole crew got together again for our Quarterly Meeting...

The post Inside Forge3: Quarterly Meeting and Top Golf! appeared first on Forge3.
item.content:encoded:
A look into our May Quarterly Meeting and Top Golf!

The whole crew got together again for our Quarterly Meeting on May 3-4, 2022. We had one full day of meetings and one full day of fun. See what exactly we were up to each day!

Getting the show on the road.

We had some of our team members traveling in from far and wide. California, Texas, South Dakota, and South Carolina, just to name a few. It’s great to be able to come together, learn, focus, and have a few laughs!

Airports to rideshares.

Alexis, Michelle, and Mark got lucky, and all landed at the same time. They reunited in an Uber! Off to the hotel they go.

The early bird gets the worm.

When we all arrived at TechVentures in Bethlehem, PA, the next morning, we knew we needed a pick-me-up for the day. Hero’s Kafe, located in the building, always delivers the best of the best! So we grabbed some yummy breakfast snacks and, of course, coffee to kickstart our day.

Hero’s Kafe to the rescue.

We all grabbed a seat and headed to the food and coffee table! The Kafe decorated the area to brighten our day.

Finally reminiscing.

As the crew ate a light breakfast and slurped coffee, we all got caught up. Many talked about how the start of the spring was going for them. Some talked about past get-togethers and trips. A few were even meeting others for the first time!

A day to remember.

With breakfast came light conversation. Everyone was so excited to be there and get started for the day!

Putting our heads together.

What better way to kick off the meeting day than with a fun activity? Each team was randomly selected and scurried over to their stations. Justine gave each group masking tape, one large marshmallow, raw spaghetti noodles, and yarn. Using all materials, each team competed to make the highest tower with the marshmallow balanced on top.

Teamwork makes the dream work.

Much easier said than done! Team 4 (Mark, Melissa, Kayla, Alexis) came out with the win!

Time to focus.

Breakfast. Coffee. Activity. Now it’s time to learn! We were all engaged and learning new things from one agenda item after another. Finally, each department head summarized how things were going this year.

Listening and taking notes.

As we listened, we took notes, asked questions, and provided our comments and opinions. It was a very successful meeting!

Food for thought.

All of the new stuff we learned made us hungry! It was time for lunch, and Hero’s Kafe was back at it again. A little something for everyone before we got back to an afternoon of meetings.

Grab a plate!

We had sandwiches, chips, empanadas, and salad. Did we mention we love their food?

A happy day to a happy hour.

We put in a full day’s work, and then it was time to unwind and head to a local restaurant for happy hour. We ordered appetizers and fun drinks down the table. There were many lively conversations going on with friendships being made and strengthened!

Our mouths were watering.

From pizza to nachos to chicken wings, we sure didn’t starve! It turned out to be a great evening.

Off to Top Golf.

We spent the final day of the retreat in New Jersey at Top Golf! When we arrived, we were taken to our reserved pods, split up, and watched as they began to set up our lunch.

Welcome to the course.

As we got to our reserved pods, we began to check everything out. From the clubs to the technology, and of course, our lunch! We enjoyed every bit of it.

Divide and conquer.

We all split up and became four small teams. Once we got situated, we ordered drinks and listened to the rules of the facility. After we all had been swinging for a while, it was time to start the competition games between each pod that included four rounds.

Let the games begin.

We played trivia, target games, and more! Each person had a different skill level, but everyone had a blast.

The grand finale.

At the end of all four rounds, the person from each pod with the best score had to go head-to-head. The goal was to pick a spot in the field where they felt confident they could hit to score points for their entire pod. The pod with the most points at the end would be the ultimate winner!

Can you guess who won? Drum roll, please! Devon and his pod (Rose, Ian, Olivia, Jared)!

Winner winner, chicken dinner.

Devon, Kassie, Mark, and Jeff competed against each other to see which pod would be the ultimate champion. Congrats to Devon and his team!

Goodbye, for now.

After a fun-filled afternoon, it was time to part ways. There were many hugs as we said our goodbyes. On our way home, we reminisced and began to look forward to our next Quarterly Meeting in August.

See you next time!

We couldn’t end the day without a group photo. It was sad to say goodbye but exciting to look forward to the next retreat.

The post Inside Forge3: Quarterly Meeting and Top Golf! appeared first on Forge3.

item.title: ActiveAgency Dashboard Is Here!
item.dc:creator: Michelle Longo
item.description:
Years in the making, we are thrilled to introduce ActiveAgency Dashboard! It’s a first-of-its-kind interface that will help independent insurance...

The post ActiveAgency Dashboard Is Here! appeared first on Forge3.
item.content:encoded:
Years in the making, we are thrilled to introduce ActiveAgency Dashboard! It’s a first-of-its-kind interface that will help independent insurance agencies look amazing, get found, sell more, and service better.

This development is huge, and we couldn’t be more proud. Dashboard is an all-new way for agencies to use the powerful sales tools and other features built into the ActiveAgency website platform to supercharge results and grow their agency. 

Forge3 Founder and CEO Jeff Teschke said, “Dashboard represents the biggest advancement in the history of ActiveAgency. Not only does it look incredible and feature new stats and analytics, but it also makes our existing best-in-class features and tools even easier to use. And most importantly, Dashboard creates a rock-solid foundation on which to build some amazing new features and integrations going forward. ActiveAgency is truly like nothing else in the industry, and I can’t wait for our 1,200+ insurance agency clients to experience Dashboard.”

Overview of Features

Dashboard is a game-changer for independent insurance agencies and will revolutionize the way they think about website management. Instead of wasting time in clunky, legacy systems, this impressive interface serves as a central hub, allowing agencies to manage everything effortlessly. Some highlights include: 

  • Beautiful new design that’s like nothing else in the industry.
  • Easy, secure access to innovative and proven sales and service tools, all in one place.
  • Interactive Success Checklist to supercharge results and agency growth.
  • Fun stats and reporting on things agencies care about most.
  • Unlimited access to friendly, human-powered support.

Devon Beck, Chief Product Officer, said, “The ActiveAgency Dashboard started as a simple concept: provide our clients access to the things they care about most on their ActiveAgency website and make it easy. I’m proud to say that, two years and hundreds of hours of development work later, that goal has been met.”

The Framework for the Future of ActiveAgency

ActiveAgency Dashboard is groundbreaking for insurance agency websites and a milestone for Forge3, which continues to pioneer record-breaking standards in the insurtech industry. Committed to continually raising the bar, Forge3 always innovates with the future in mind. Liz Allebach, Group Product Manager, noted, “Dashboard is our new foundation. We will be able to create so many new features, and I am excited to see where Dashboard will take us in the future!”  

Beck added, “Dashboard pushes the industry forward tenfold with its ease-of-use, eye-catching interface, and ability to act as a springboard for new ideas within the insurtech space.”

Pricing and Availability

Dashboard is available now and included at no additional cost with an ActiveAgency subscription, which features simple pricing and no long-term contracts. Signature tools like Clickable Coverage, Hello Producer, Video Proposals, and Power Panels are always included. For more information on ActiveAgency Dashboard, visit our ActiveAgency page. 

For the full press release, visit PRLog.



The post ActiveAgency Dashboard Is Here! appeared first on Forge3.

item.title: Inside Forge3: Milestone Trip to Captiva, FL!
item.dc:creator: Monika Baraket
item.description:
A recap of our recent team trip! Ahoy, matey! Yet another milestone trip is in the books, and we are...

The post Inside Forge3: Milestone Trip to Captiva, FL! appeared first on Forge3.
item.content:encoded:
A recap of our recent team trip!

Ahoy, matey! Yet another milestone trip is in the books, and we are still reminiscing. It was a time for team bonding, relaxation, and feeling ecstatic about recent accomplishments.

One of those accomplishments we hit was a big one – 1,000 accounts! The team crushed it, and we’re already well on our way to our next one. What better way to celebrate than to head back to Captiva Island, just like we did in 2020?! We all traveled to Florida from near and far, including Pennsylvania, California, South Dakota, and Texas.

Escaping the nor'easter.

The beginning of the trip was a bit rocky. The forecast was calling for a nor’easter, and flights were getting canceled left and right. So, we took action! Some of us left a day early to escape the storm, those outside of Pennsylvania left on schedule, and some of us decided to wait it out and left a day late, but we were all determined to arrive in Florida at some point!

Determined to get to Captiva!

The team was a bit split up, but we got to Captiva all in one piece.

Getting settled in at Sea Oats.

Upon arrival, it wasn’t as warm as you would expect on a Floridian island. We must have brought the chilly weather down with us! Good thing we had a fire pit to use right away. We fired that up as we waited to get into the house.

Fire pit fun.

Justine was flexing her camping skills and got the fire started so we could warm up.

Exploring our new digs.

After defrosting by the fire, we spent the next couple of hours exploring the property, finding our assigned rooms, and setting up our home away from home.

Our own private resort.

This place is pretty amazing! What more could you want as a home away from home?

A time for fun and a time for work.

Jeff didn’t make the trip because he was grinding at a conference in Texas! The entire team was bummed that he couldn’t make it but appreciated his hustle while we were having fun in the sun. We even made a cardboard cutout of his head so he could join us on all our adventures! Devon graciously gave up one outfit he packed so that Jeff could look his best as he posed next to the pool for a while.

We got creative.

Cardboard cutout Jeff went a lot of places with us! We think he enjoyed his time in Captiva.

Breakfast made to order.

Each morning, Ian had his pad and paper ready to take breakfast orders down. Some ate omelets, some had bagels, and others just wanted a nice hot cup of coffee. But, no matter the order, Ian got right on it.

Chef Ian.

Breakfast every morning was a hit! Everyone looked forward to a light meal to start their day on the island.

Activities, relaxing, and more.

We packed in a lot of activities during our stay! Relaxing was on our agenda, but we also snuck in a lot of fun, including kayaking, paddle boarding, fishing, shell searching, sun tanning, bike riding, tennis, ping pong, and a ton more.

So many fun things to do.

Everyone did a little bit of everything, and some of us got way out of our comfort zone paddle boarding and kayaking with the alligators.

Family-style dinners.

Each night we all pitched in and helped make an amazing dinner. Our head chef was usually Ian, but he had sidekicks here and there. Our menus consisted of pizza, grilled burgers, and hot dogs, pasta, and then some. Once the meal was served, we all sat together at the big dining room table and enjoyed tasty food and great conversation.

Good ol’ home cookin’!

We became quite the chefs in the kitchen! Having a fun meal that we all made together each night was the best.

It's all fun and games.

After dinner each night, we played games until we couldn’t keep our eyes open anymore. We were always entertained, from board games to card games and dice games to cell phone games. Our stomach muscles were sore from laughing so hard!

Friendly competition.

Things got a little competitive, but all in good fun. We had some late nights of laughter, that is for sure!

Friendships were made.

As a remote company, getting to know one another can be difficult. Our milestone trips are not only a way to celebrate our accomplishments, but to also bond with one another. Everyone had their own space, but if they wanted company, it wasn’t hard to find. True connections were made throughout the entire team, and everyone went home with a new friend. You can’t beat that!

Devon, our Chief Product Officer, said it best. “It’s a magical thing when 18 different people from across the country can live in a house together for five days and come out of it drama-free with a deeper appreciation and connection to each other and the company they work for. I’m truly blessed to be part of this team!”

Pigtails for pals.

Alexis and Bethany bonded over their new do’s done by Kassie!

A sunset cruise to remember.

We ended the trip with a sunset cruise through the bay and into the ocean. The boat guides shared some interesting history with us along the way! It was a great time for sightseeing and lots of conversation. We all talked about our favorite parts of the trip while jamming out to some tunes.

The sun goes down.

The whole group had a relaxing yet laughter-filled sunset cruise to end the evening.

That's a wrap!

We had a truly unforgettable adventure with the entire team. We were all sad to pack up and leave the mansion. More importantly, we were all sad to leave each other. We work hard to play hard and are ready to hit our next milestone. Where should we go next?

Until next time.

Ian, Manager of Content Management, spoke for us all when he said, “Being on ‘island time’ in Captiva let us slow down, reflect, and take account of our company culture. Whether it was exploring the island with low battery golf carts, fishing for seaweed (and Mahi Mahi), or watching the stars on the beach at night, the best part of this trip was getting to know everyone better and feeling a true connection with each and every person on the team.”

The post Inside Forge3: Milestone Trip to Captiva, FL! appeared first on Forge3.

item.title: Inside Forge3: Promotions and Team Updates!
item.dc:creator: Michelle Longo
item.description:
There’s never a dull moment at Forge3! Things have been busier than ever for the team at Forge3, in part...

The post Inside Forge3: Promotions and Team Updates! appeared first on Forge3.
item.content:encoded:
There’s never a dull moment at Forge3!

Things have been busier than ever for the team at Forge3, in part because we’ve had a number of promotions and position changes. Please join us in offering up a big congratulations to this amazing group of people!

Devon Beck

Devon has been promoted to Chief Product Officer. He says…

I joined Forge3 three years ago because I believed in its mission to help independent insurance agencies find an affordable and amazing solution for their website needs. Since joining, I have been able to play a key role in Forge3’s growth through innovation to its core ActiveAgency product and by developing features like Video Proposals and Power Panels. In this new role, I am thrilled to elevate Forge3’s core product development as we continue to be the highest-rated and fastest-growing website solution in the insurance industry!

Liz Allebach

Liz has been promoted to Group Product Manager. She says…

With this promotion, I will be leading our Production and Client Experience teams, as well as product design and fulfillment for Forge3. I am excited to be able to work directly with my team members while still having my hands in designing our product, ActiveAgency. Excited to see what our team can do next!

Michelle Longo

Michelle has been promoted to Marketing Manager. She says…

I’m delighted to take on the role of Marketing Manager for Forge3! This is an amazing opportunity to build the Marketing department from the ground up and grow within a dynamic organization. I’m looking forward to all that’s to come while working alongside this terrific team.

Rose Hayes

Rose has been promoted to Manager of Project Management. She says…

I am so grateful for this opportunity to lead the Project Management department. We have such a strong team, and they make it look easy! I can’t wait to dive deeper into our processes and projects so we can keep forging ahead!

Ian Zeiders

Ian has been promoted to Manager of Content Management. He says…

Here at Forge3, we’ve always taken a content-first approach to the websites we create for each and every project we work on. To me, that highlights the importance of the behind-the-scenes work the Content Management team does. With this new role of Manager of Content Management, I look forward to playing an integral part in helping our department, the ActiveAgency product, and the company itself grow and evolve as we move into the future.

Joleen Fetter

Joleen has been promoted to Manager of Visual Design. She says…

It has been an exciting journey so far, and I am incredibly grateful for the opportunity I have been given. I genuinely don’t think I can put into words what this company or my new role means to me. For now, I’m motivated to continue what I have started and to continue working alongside the talented Visual Design team here at Forge3!

Kayla Mjaatvedt

Kayla has been promoted to Manager of Client Experience. She says…

My time on the Client Experience team with Forge3 has been nothing short of rewarding. I’m beyond excited to take on this new role as Manager of Client Experience and am looking forward to the continued growth of our department and team as a whole.

Alexis Nasser

Alexis has transitioned to the role of Marketing Coordinator. She says…

I am so thrilled to step into the Marketing Coordinator role! I’m ready to dive deeper into partnerships, attend industry conferences, work with ongoing video and social communications, and so much more. It’s all right up my alley and I’m so jacked to get started.

Steph Brace

Steph has transitioned to the role of Technical Product Owner. She says…

I’m thrilled to be stepping into the new role of Technical Product Owner. I’ve been a Visual Designer at Forge3 since 2020, and during that time I’ve developed an interest in the impressive structure behind ActiveAgency. Learning about the technical side of things, as well as the many product integrations we offer, has been fascinating so far!

The post Inside Forge3: Promotions and Team Updates! appeared first on Forge3.

item.title: Announcing ActiveAgency Magenta!
item.dc:creator: Michelle Longo
item.description:
We are very excited to announce the release of the latest version of ActiveAgency, Magenta! ActiveAgency already had everything an...

The post Announcing ActiveAgency Magenta! appeared first on Forge3.
item.content:encoded:
We are very excited to announce the release of the latest version of ActiveAgency, Magenta! ActiveAgency already had everything an independent insurance agency needed for a unique and effective website, with Magenta adding increased functionality and scores of new design elements. Committed to helping agencies reach more prospects and assist existing clients in managing their insurance needs, ActiveAgency Magenta is conversion-focused and the most accessible version of the platform yet.

Each version of the platform is built with the future in mind, and existing ActiveAgency users can take advantage of many new enhancements. Older ActiveAgency websites are as beautiful, interactive, and effective as they ever have been, now with even more powerful tools available. Signature features like Clickable Coverage, Hello Producer, Video Proposals, and Power Panels also work seamlessly on all versions of the platform and remain a total wow factor for clients and prospects alike.

Liz Allebach, Group Product Manager, said, “Magenta is the best insurance website the industry has seen. While building Magenta, our team considered what an agency really needs to be relevant in 2022. They need a website that highlights their reputation and strong social credibility. The website needs to highlight what the agency cares about and what the agency’s local market values. It should also convey why choosing an independent insurance agency is a better choice than writing directly with a carrier. Magenta does that…and more!”

“For me,” Ian Zeiders, Manager of Content Management, added, “the coolest part of Magenta is the extra emphasis on making websites that are even more user-friendly. From the way the coverage pages have been restructured to the accessibility of relevant calls-to-action in the menus, footer, and across the site, I think Magenta will help users find what they are looking for and make informed decisions based on what they find.”

Manager of Visual Design, Joleen Fetter, said, “I have been excited about ActiveAgency Magenta’s release for some time now. There has been an incredibly talented team behind Magenta’s development, and it has been gratifying to see it come full circle. Now that it is time for Magenta to be used to its full advantage, I can’t wait to see what happens next.”

Steph Brace, Technical Product Owner, said, “From a design perspective alone, Magenta is such a fresh take on ActiveAgency. Every element of a Magenta site is bolder, sharper, and even more engaging than previous versions of ActiveAgency. Magenta is conversion-focused, easy to navigate, and super dynamic. Customizing ActiveAgency sites for the unique needs of our clients just became even easier and more fun, and that shines through in our designs!”

Two exciting changes that existing ActiveAgency clients can take advantage of include the dedicated Clickable Coverage page showing all graphics in one place, as well as the enhanced Hello Producer capabilities. See it in action at the bottom right of the page. Those who want even more changes might also consider a full refresh for their website.

The post Announcing ActiveAgency Magenta! appeared first on Forge3.

item.title: Inside Forge3: Best Things of 2021!
item.dc:creator: Michelle Longo
item.description:
Happy New Year! Now that 2021 is in the rearview mirror, we wanted to take a minute to reflect back...

The post Inside Forge3: Best Things of 2021! appeared first on Forge3.
item.content:encoded:
Happy New Year!

Now that 2021 is in the rearview mirror, we wanted to take a minute to reflect back on the year’s events. We asked our team to tell us the best thing that happened last year. Here’s what they had to say!

Bethany Jorgensen

Bethany, a Project Manager, says…

One of the best things of 2021 was going to Walt Disney World with a group of our best friends!

Joleen Fetter

Joleen, a Visual Designer, says…

For me, the best thing about 2021 was friends and family. It was great to reconnect with so many loved ones after many months apart, and I was lucky enough to have this occur at multiple weddings!

Alexis Nasser

Alexis, a Client Experience Manager, says…

We decided to celebrate our four-year anniversary by taking a road trip through Wyoming, including Sheridan, Cody, Yellowstone, and Jackson Hole. From antiquing and horseback riding to Old Faithful and bear sightings, we couldn’t have asked for a more scenic and relaxing anniversary.

Melissa Marzan

Melissa, a Project Manager, says…

In 2021, aside from landing one of the best jobs on Earth at Forge3, I had the pleasure of visiting “the most magical place on Earth,” Disney World. So I guess you can say 2021 was a year where dreams came true for me!

Liz Allebach

Liz, our Product Implementation Manager, says…

Aside from completing Magenta with the team, the best thing to happen to me in 2021 was that I was able to spend dedicated time with my family. Can’t ask for anything better than that!

Steph Brace

Steph, a Visual Designer, says…

The best thing about 2021 was being outside! COVID made us get creative, and my family and I had so much fun visiting waterfalls, going to the zoo, seeing lakes and beaches, studying birds, and sledding.

Eric Martinez

Eric, a Visual Designer, says…

2021 has been a journey of a year with many milestones! Two big milestones I will remember and am so thankful for are joining the Forge3 family back in March and purchasing my first home this past fall!

Becky Hane

Becky, a Content Manager, says…

In 2021, I finished the first draft of my first-ever fantasy book! After years and years of starting books and never finishing them, I finally managed to do it, and I’d say that’s definitely one of the best things that happened to me that year.

Carolyn Enigk

Carolyn, a Client Experience Manager, says…

The best thing about 2021 was moving into my own place for the first time in my life! I’ve loved every part of having my own house; the decorating, the cooking, the budgeting, even the cleaning. I can’t wait to see what 2022 will have in store for me!

Keira Lenig

Keira, a Visual Designer, says…

One of the best things about 2021 was growing my tomato plants from seeds for the first time in my new home!

Monika Baraket

Monika, our Chief Operating Officer, says…

My best thing about 2021 is my oldest, Matt, figuring out his passion. Matt was accepted to Ithaca College’s very competitive six-year doctor of physical therapy program and also committed to play football for the Bombers! My husband and I are very proud of his accomplishments.

Jillia English

Jillia, a Visual Designer, says…

The best thing about 2021 was getting back to adventures and traveling. This is a photo of the Versace Mansion I took while on vacation in Miami Beach.

Rose Hayes

Rose, our Lead Project Manager, says…

The best part of 2021 was getting engaged to my favorite person!

Michelle Longo

Michelle, our Digital Marketing Specialist, says…

After three years of training, I earned my black belt in December! And to make it an extra special day, I got to share it with my 15-year-old son, who earned his 3rd-degree black belt at the same time. I couldn’t be more proud of him or myself.

Kayla Mjaatvedt

Kayla, a Client Experience Manager, says…

In 2021, I met the love of my life. I also watched my brother marry the love of his life, and I gained a sister in the process. What a year!

Devon Beck

Devon, our Director of Technology, says…

My favorite thing of 2021 is pretty much my favorite thing of every year: summer vacation at the beach!

The post Inside Forge3: Best Things of 2021! appeared first on Forge3.

item.title: Inside Forge3: Annual Meeting and Big Day Out!
item.dc:creator: Michelle Longo
item.description:
Behind the scenes at our Annual Team Meeting and Big Day Out! On October 7-8, 2021, the Forge3 team members...

The post Inside Forge3: Annual Meeting and Big Day Out! appeared first on Forge3.
item.content:encoded:
Behind the scenes at our Annual Team Meeting and Big Day Out!

On October 7-8, 2021, the Forge3 team members from around the country gathered in Pennsylvania for two days of information, strategizing, and camaraderie! Everyone got a lot of work done but had tons of fun too. Here are the highlights!

Day 1.

Starting our day the Forge3 way.

We gathered bright and early to get to work. But not before we admired our new Forge3 swag and the cupcakes Carolyn made for us!

Not your ordinary team meeting.

Answer in the form of a question.

We kicked off the meeting with a game of Jeopardy! It was battle to find to find out who knew the most about Forge3 history, team member trivia, ActiveAgency facts, and more.

Getting down to business.

Information and learning were on the agenda.

We got down to business to talk about all the amazing things happening at Forge3, including all we’ve accomplished and what’s coming up next. We’re super excited for the future and can’t wait to show you what we’ve been working on!

A delicious hibachi lunch.

Fueling up for more.

We took some time out for a brain break to enjoy a fantastic lunch at KOME Japanese Cuisine in Center Valley. 

Day 2.

Our Big Day Out with Pocono Whitewater.

We gathered first thing to begin our Big Day Out. Once everyone arrived, we hopped on the bus to begin our first leg.

First up: A bike ride.

Go big or go home.

We started off with a 21-mile bike ride on the Lehigh Gorge Rail Trail!

An adventure on two wheels.

And away we go!

We had lots of time to chat with each other as we pedaled our morning away.

A scenic journey along the Lehigh River.

A perfect fall morning.

The weather was gorgeous and so was the foliage!

Plenty of photo ops.

21 miles is far.

We took some breaks along the way to catch our breath and enjoy the day.

Back at it.

We’re rolling!

We couldn’t stop for long because more fun awaited us!

OK, maybe a few more breaks.

It’s not everyday you’re in the woods with your teammates.

We definitely didn’t miss our chances to take some pictures!

The waterfall.

Nature at its finest.

This picture doesn’t do the waterfall justice. We had to stop and take a group shot here.

Next up: A hike.

Or was it more of a climb?

After a quick lunch on the bank of the river, we embarked on a 2-mile hike. It was pretty steep, but it was worth it once we got to the top.

More than just a mountain.

An unexpected discovery.

The view from the peak was amazing. After taking a breather, we hiked back down. Next, we walked through an abandoned train tunnel.

The final leg: Whitewater rafting.

A new experience for many.

We divided up into four rafts to begin our 11-mile journey down the Lehigh River. This was the first time many of us had ever rafted, so it was quite an adventure!

A guided tour down the river.

It was not a leisurely float.

The rapids were enough for us to all be soaking wet, but each raft had a bucket and we didn’t miss the chance to toss freezing water at each other!

An unforgettable time.

Work hard and play hard.

We capped off the day with dinner and a bonfire. When they named the experience the Big Day Out, they were not kidding around. We were exhausted by the end, but we had an amazing time taking team building to the extreme!

It was back to work Monday morning, with fantastic memories and a drive to make the year ahead as fantastic as the last. Until next time!

The post Inside Forge3: Annual Meeting and Big Day Out! appeared first on Forge3.
